column4: description
column5: defeatedDescription
column6: goal

column4: You have the element of surprise!
column5: Catching the orc off guard, you are able to dispatch him with relative ease.

column4: This orc wears more axes than armor.
column5: You deftly avoid axe after axe before leaping in for the moral strike.

column4: The orc carries a massive club with relative ease.
column5: You step between the orc's corpse and the craters left in the ground by its massive club.

column4: The scarred orc veteran raises his twin axes in challenge and bares cracked teeth in a confident snarl.
column5: Your final strike sends a cracked fang hurtling across the room before sticking into a wall.

column4: With a single gesture, this bestial orc unleashes the fury of his trained war hounds upon you.
column5: As soon as the master fall, the hounds lose their will to fight and run off to find a new alpha.

column4: The orc taskmaster pushes aside his lesser kin, determined to kill you for his own glory.
column5: The orc mutters something unintelligible, but clearly spiteful, before the last lights fade from its eyes.

column4: Missing its right eye and covered in scars, the monstrous orc flies into a sudden rage and charges you!
column5: The orc curses you as its one remaining eye closes forever.

column4: The scouts have done a good job of finding the next victims for the warband to follow.
column5: You defeat the scouts, unsure of whether or not they were able to signal the warband nearby.

column4: Following their scouts, the orc warband raises its weapons and yells for the battle to come.
column5: The warband defeated, the scouts run off to report their failed mission.

column4: A mindless wave of orcs trip over one another in an attempt to be the first to draw your blood.
column5: You stand victorious atop a mound of gray flesh. Next time they'll need to send more orcs...

column4: This particular gnoll doesn't want to stay down...
column5: Seemingly unkillable, you hope this time the gnoll will stay dead.

column4: Are you tracking the gnoll or is the gnoll tracking you?
column5: A deadly game of cat and mouse ends with a mess of gnoll blood and fur.

column4: You catch a glimpse of dirty, reddish-brown fur before it disappears from view.
column5: You track the gnoll for a while, waiting for the perfect moment to strike. The creature didn't stand a chance...

column4: The gnolls snarl and bark orders to one another as they get into the best possible position to hunt their prey.
column5: You surprise the hunting party, sending them into a frenzy and removing their ability to coordinate, making them much easier to defeat.

column4: Exile has not done anything to calm the wild in this gnoll.
column5: The wild creature bites and claws until its final breath.

column4: Hiding behind a rock, this crafty gnoll is almost able to get the drop on you.
column5: A clever gnoll to be sure, but not quite clever enough.

column4: You think you hear something rustling in the shadows...
column5: The shadows held more gnolls than should have been possible... you suspect magical assistance.

column4: The gnolls bark and yip at one another as they wander around the area.
column5: You had hoped to avoid the patrol, but after they caught your scent you had no choice but to put them down.

column4: The gnolls smile as their victim screams and begs for a quick death.
column5: You kick over the last of the grotesque effigies as you release the would-be victim.

column4: The hyena-like laughter of this crazed creature will haunt you for weeks.
column5: Defeated, the crazed gnoll's laugh echoes in your mind.

column4: The spiders grow unnaturally large around here.
column5: You shove the spider's carcass aside and continue on your journey.

column4: With the sound of a dozen swords striking against stone, the giant spider rushes toward you on its sword-like limbs.
column5: Though it was a single creature, you feel like you've just battled a company of soldiers.

column4: You think you catch a glimpse of the spider before it shifts out of the material plane.
column5: After sustaining multiple wounds, the spider shifts out of the material plane everything goes silent. You wait for a while but it doesn't seem to be coming back.

column4: Acidic poison drips from the massive spider's fangs.
column5: You stand victorious over the bristle spider, acidic burns scarring your body.

column4: The giant spider hurls itself into the air, and is on you almost before you can draw steel.
column5: You plunge your weapon into the spider as it lands on top of you. And just like that, the battle is over.

column4: You stumble across the arachnoid as it begins to plant its eggs into the corpse of its most recent victim.
column5: The tomb spider defeated, you set fire to the corpse containing the clutch of spider eggs.

column4: Best to deal with these before they hatch.
column5: Setting fire to the nests of eggs, you decide to move along before the mother spider sees what you've done.

column4: A web this size seems intended for something larger than you.
column5: You're able to avoid most of the web and have no trouble cutting through other sections.

column4: You turn around just in time to see your eight-legged attacker strike from the shadows.
column5: The spider is defeated. Had you spotted it a second later, the outcome might have been very different.

column4: You don't think it's seen you yet. This is your chance to get the upper hand!
column5: The spider falls, never having seen its attacker.

column4: The creature sniffs at a pile of corpses.
column5: Now defeated, the wererat shifts back into human form.

column4: The bandit changes form before your eyes!
column5: "You will see me again!" the mugger yells as it runs off into the shadows.

column4: The wererat alternates rapier strikes with a lunging bite.
column5: You stand over the defeated rogue, glad none of the bites were able to land.

column4: The wererat comes at you without stealth, certain of an easy kill.
column5: The sewer guard's overconfidence proved to be its downfall.

column4: The reeking stench of this venomous mage hits you even before his spells.
column5: It will take many, many baths before the stench of this creature washes off of you.

column4: These creatures make it hard to know who to trust...
column5: You're fairly sure you've taken care of all the wererats, but you can't be positive.

column4: They appear to be returning from a recently successful mission.
column5: You catch the spies off guard, ensuring whatever mission they just completed was their last.

column4: You might not have paid the travelers a second glance, had a bloody arm not slid out from under their wagon's coverings.
column5: Smugglers defeated, you look under the coverings and see a wagon full of bodies. Someone or some thing is going to be very disappointed.

column4: Careful to avoid the poison dripping from their blades, you slowly circle away from the would-be robbers.
column5: Victorious, you check yourself for any cuts from the poisoned blades. Looks like you got lucky.

column4: A mixture of men and rats, the patrol moves through the area, unaware of your presence.
column5: The wererats shifted back and forth, doing their best to confuse and disorient. But in the end, no tactic was good enough to defeat you.

column4: You hear wood scrape against bone as the skeleton takes aim.
column5: The wooden bow rattles against the pile of bones now littering the floor.

column4: A low, dry moan floats from the shadows.
column5: A final, merciful strike the head ends the zombie's torment.

column4: Skeletal archers draw their bows and take aim. You have to hope some of them will miss.
column5: You're not sure how you survived the barrage of arrows, but there you stand over piles of bones.

column4: You see an arrow bounce off the wall next to you. It's hard to pinpoint its origin.
column5: You're still not sure where the arrows were coming from, but they seem to have stopped for now.

column4: A wall slides away, revealing a row of skeletal archers, bows at the ready!
column5: Dodging the initial strike, you're able to take out the skeletons before they can nock another arrow.

column4: The skeletal hound sits at the feet of an undead archer, perhaps master and pet in another life.
column5: You defeat both undead abominations. Hopefully they can rest peacefully now.

column4: Covered in the ashes of a past tragedy, these lost souls shamble aimlessly across the land.
column5: You will never know the suffering these people went through. At least it's over now.

column4: You see a dried and withered husk, still clutching a mining pick.
column5: With one final strike, you end the torment of the last ashen zombie.

column4: They almost seem to blame you for their fate...
column5: The last zombie falls, its hand reaching for your throat. As its hand curls, a single finger points at you before crumbling to dust.

column4: Still smoking as though freshly burned, the pack of zombie moans and shambles towards you.
column5: Bits of ash float through the room, the only sign that a battle had taken place.

column4: A well-hidden trap.
column5: You're able to avoid the blade trap altogether.

column4: Someone has worked hard to hide this trap.
column5: You trigger the trap but dodge the arrow at the last second.

column4: The pressure plate is well hidden, but not invisible.
column5: You are able to disable the dart trap without triggering it.

column4: Small scratches near a hole in the wall give you pause.
column5: Upon further inspection, this is, in fact, a spear trap. Knowing what you're up against, you're able to avoid it.

column4: A single trigger is all that stands between life and death beneath tons of stone.
column5: You purposely trigger the rockfall trap from a distance so as to not be hit by it.

column4: What first appeared to be a pressure plate was just a decoy for the real danger in the room.
column5: You're able to identify the real threat before it's triggered.

column4: The floor slowly disappears into the wall, revealing a blazing fire below.
column5: Hopping along the edges of the room, you're able to escape before being swallowed into the fire.

column4: Just because it's not working right, doesn't mean it can't still kill you.
column5: You decide it's better to leave this trap undisturbed, rather than trying to disarm it...

column4: No one will be able to hear your cries for help should you end up at the bottom of this pit.
column5: You disarm the pit trap, move past it, and rearm it should anyone be trying to follow you.

column4: The ground looks stable enough, but you have the feeling you should tread carefully.
column5: You're able to disarm the trap before the first boot sinks into the ground.

column4: It is well this sturdy chest was reinforced with steel bands, for something has tried to open it before.
column5: You break the steel bands, revealing the treasure within!

column4: Piles of coin lie scattered here, as if thieves were interrupted while counting their ill-gotten gains.
column5: You collect the coins and move on.

column4: Lost in the corner of this looted room is a small pouch holding gems worth far more than a few coins.
column5: You open the purse and collect the small but valuable treasure.

column4: This strange jeweled box seemingly appeared out of nowhere and glows with a curious light.
column5: The enchantment broken, you open the lockbox and collect the rewards.

column4: Strange scrolls covered in arcane writing could portend great wisdom or great danger.
column5: You collect the loot but decide to inspect it further later.

column4: This simple wooden crate has yet to be opened.
column5: The crate proves to be no real challenge and you open it with ease.

column4: Rune-imprinted wax coats the outside of the box, keeping the seal, and treasure, intact.
column5: You break the seal and collect the treasures within.

column4: The line of coins makes you think either someone had their purse cut or they're leaving a very expensive trail back home.
column5: You follow the trail for a while before deciding any additional rewards are not worth the obvious trap that awaits.

column4: You find a store of well-preserved goods. Truly a welcome sight.
column5: You take a moment to enjoy the found spoils before moving on.

column4: In this light it's hard to tell the quality of the items locked on the rack.
column5: You reach for the most valuable-looking item and continue on your adventure.

column4: The light of your torches dim to pale sparks as the shadows of the corridor draw closer.
column5: Moving quickly, you find yourself in a hidden location.

column4: This lever has been etched with a warning by someone who came before you.
column5: Gears moan and squeal as a secret passage is revealed.

column4: Someone has tried to seal and bar shut this trap door, though you cannot see why.
column5: A defeated abomination lies on the floor near the opened trap door. So that's why it was closed...

column4: This seems too easy...
column5: Oddly enough, this proved to be just as easy as you'd expected...

column4: A strange mist obscures your vision past the first few steps.
column5: Once into the mist, you find yourself in an impossible location as though you've been magically transported.

column4: A sturdy wooden door reinforced with bands of iron.
column5: You decide to pick the lock after trying and failing to muscle your way through.

column4: A hastily constructed barricade seals the doorway.
column5: With everyone working together, the barricade is quickly torn down.

column4: Something about this stone wall feels wrong...
column5: You press an oddly-smooth stone and the wall slides open, revealing another area.

column4: Someone has gone through a lot of effort to repair this seemingly mundane door.
column5: You almost feel bad breaking down the newly repaired door. Almost.

column4: Maybe if you put the Three Jade Lions over there, then turned the dial, and then turned the crone statue around...
column5: Rotating the last holy symbol to fit perfectly with the second crone statue causes the door to fly open.

column4: The mirror begins to distort and bend as your twisted reflections push against its surface and laugh with malevolent alien voices.
column5: Shattering the mirror, you hear otherworldly curses mixed with screams of suffering before the room goes unnaturally silent.

column4: A line of lit torches runs off into the darkness, as if someone was beckoning you to follow.
column5: You follow the torches and find the corpse of a failed adventurer. Perhaps this was to be his way back out...

column4: "I'll help you however I can, just don't let them eat me!" cries the old merchant as the creatures in the shadows circle closer.
column5: Monstrous corpses litter the floor. "I can never thank you enough!" the merchant exclaims, "here, take this!"

column4: A mighty wizard stands frozen in time mid-battle with an otherworldly foe.
column5: You try for a while to revive the wizard, but ultimately determine that it would release the monster as well. Best to let them be.

column4: Whoever dug up this grave was met halfway by whatever had been buried there.
column5: You find a few scavenging creatures, but nothing that would have been buried in the grave. It would be wise to keep your guard up.

column4: After assuring yourself that this statue has not moved, you plainly see it wink as you're about to walk away.
column5: You poke and prod at the statue but can't get it to move again. Must have been a trick of the light.

column4: "Though I am here on my own quest, perhaps I can be of help to you?" says the kindly priest.
column5: After spending some time with the priest, you feel a sense of calm and renewed purpose.

column4: The steely-eyed leader of the dwarven band carefully pours dark liquor from a bottle into your glass as his brethren chant.
column5: You slam your mug down and stand... well, sit... wobbly but triumphant at the table.

column4: You feel at peace in this sanctified place.
column5: The shrine glows until you are completely at peace and then fades as though suggesting you continue on your adventure.

column4: You hide in the shadows as the standing stones sing in slow sad voices of all the things which they have seen.
column5: You watch the stones for a while until you realize you are being drawn into their despair. You use the last of your willpower to move past them.

column4: The pit master looks you up and down and readies a challenge he thinks will be just right to kill you.
column5: Looks like the pit master underestimated your prowess. He won't make that mistake again.

column4: The only sound you can hear in this supernatural silence is the beating of your own heart.
column5: With a deft strike, you drop the wizard that was casting the silence spell, just in time to hear his final whimper.

column4: Bones gnawed clean are gathered in a massive pile reaching to the ceiling.
column5: The beast that had built the pile lies dead at your feet, its body now added to the stack.

column4: It is difficult to keep your footing on these slick black stones, forcing you to move with care.
column5: You fall a few times, but nothing you can't recover from.

column4: War banners of a dozen orc clans are gathered here, either as warnings or as trophies.
column5: You set fire to the banners which attracts the attention of a group of orcs, allowing your ambush to go off exactly as planned.

column4: The words are too worn away for you to know who was once buried here.
column5: A chill runs up your spine as you make out your own name on the tomb...

column4: Majestically posed, you find the stuffed corpses of a bear and wolf. "Want to hear how I took them down?" asks a voice from the shadows.
column5: You take the time to pose the fallen hunter beneath his stuffed trophies.

column4: Scrawled hastily and stuck to the wall with a knife is a small piece of paper with the words, "Be afraid."
column5: While you're examining the note, you feel ghostly fingers run along your shoulder and across your throat. You re-pin the note to the wall and leave as quickly as possible.

column4: A pair of orcs chant quietly while a gnoll, kneeling in the center of a circle, raises a jagged blade into the air and begins to lower it slowly towards its own head.
column5: You stop the ritual before it can complete. You may never know what unholy thing they were attempting.

column4: As soon as you step into the room, the scene changes to an ethereal party; a celebration held by ghosts remembering better days long since past.
column5: You join the ghosts and listen as the reminisce about their former lives and loves.

column4: A slender man with a toothy grin sits in a large, red chair. He motions to a similar chair and holds out a glass of brandy.
column5: You awaken some time later, the taste of brandy still on your tongue. The strange man is nowhere to be seen.

column4: Game pieces the size of men stand on top of a painted board. A gnome on the far side of the room yells to you, "I go first!"
column5: "Not fair! Not fair! You cheated!" the gnome cries as he runs off, the loser at his own game.

column4: A merchant sits staring at a damaged wheel, "Doomed. They'll be back and I'll be dead..."
column5: The thief-in-merchant's-clothing lies dead at your feet. If he had accomplices, they're staying away from you.

column4: "I know what you're thinking. We aren't all like that, you know. Of course my sister follows the old ways, but stay away from her and you should be fine."
column5: The witch thanks you for your company and offers some parting advice, "My sister cannot be reasoned with. If you see her, kill her."

column4: "I know what you're thinking. And you're right... crossing my path is the last mistake you will ever make. A shame you didn't find my sister instead."
column5: The fatal blow dealt, the witch bursts into green flames, leaving no mortal remains.

column4: For a moment you're tempted to keep the cub and raise it as your own.
column5: The cub follows you for a while before getting distracted by a far-away noise and running off into the darkness.

column4: Through a grating and embedded in awful filth, you see the small shine of something potentially valuable.
column5: You dig out a small metal shard. It looks like a piece of intricately engraved armor, but far too damaged to be of any further use.

column4: You find a large crystal ball containing a small goblin's skull and for a moment are convinced it is speaking to you...
column5: You finish your conversation with the enchanted goblin skull, wondering if anyone will believe this actually happened.

column4: A slow drip of green falls from the ceiling and splashes into a large green puddle.
column5: You see the slime come together, forming a cube-like shape. Today, discretion will be the better part of valor...

column4: A path of floating earth provides a way to cross the chasm before you.
column5: You cross to the other side and look back at the floating earth, wondering how long the spell will persist.

column4: Wealth and treasures from a dozen lands have all been haphazardly piled here.
column5: You gather the most valuable items and make your way back to the area's entrance. Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Riches await in the Treasure Room.

column4: Secret doors and trapped locks hide this store of hidden treasure.
column5: You secure the storehouse and search through to find it filled with riches! Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Discover the treasure in the Hidden Storehouse.

column4: Great numbers of gemstones and jewels cover every surface of this room.
column5: You pry the best gems loose and fill your packs until you can carry no more. Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Valuable stones await in the Gem Storage Vault.

column4: Floating spires covered in tomes and grimoires rise up from the mist, their pages opening to you.
column5: You could spend a lifetime in this library, but for now you gather the rarest and most ancient tomes. Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Read through the magical tomes in the Enchanted Library.

column4: The glitter of gold reflects off of the endless prisms of this crystalline chamber.
column5: Everything here looks so valuable, it's hard to know what to take... Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Unlock the secret of the Crystal Chamber.

column4: Creatures of all types circle the fountain, prepared to defend it from all potential thieves.
column5: The last monster defeated, you take a sip from the fountain and feel ten years younger. So the stories were true! Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Drink the water of life that flows from the Magic Fountain.

column4: As you reach over to touch a gem embedded in a statue of a fallen hero, you are surprised to feel a cold, marble hand on your back.
column5: The construct defeated, you are able to take a deep breath and truly taken in the majesty of the shrine. Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Find the truth long-since buried within the Shrine of Heroes.

column4: Luxurious and unnecessarily showy, the is clearly the final resting place of someone with far too much gold and far too little sense.
column5: The ghost of the prince defeated, the corrupted tomb is yours to raid. Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: See the gaudy opulence of the Princely Tomb.

column4: Veins of silver are visible in all of the surrounding walls. A clang of weapons tells you you're not the only ones to notice...
column5: You defeat the other would-be prospectors, claiming the silver mine for your own. Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: Legend speaks of a Lost Silver Mine.

column4: This area was once used to entertain and years later many valuable items still remain.
column5: Every bit as rich as rumored, you take the most valuable items before leaving the hall. Congratulations! Your quest is complete!
column6: You've heard rumors of an abandoned Grand Hall still filled with riches.

column4: Commanding a legion of orcish minions, Makred the Foul is a danger to all who enter this place.
column5: All of his underlings defeated, Makred finally falls to your relentless assault.
column6: Defeat the Eye of Gruumsh known as Makred the Foul.

column4: A fearsome orc, Kartok Paingiver has bathed many times in the blood of his enemies.
column5: The remaining orcs look on in terror as Kartok falls to your attack. They attack, but their heart isn't in it and they fall easily.
column6: Do not allow Kartok Paingiver to leave this place alive.

column4: Commander of the Many-Arrows orc tribe, Vansi Bloodscar is rarely caught alone.
column5: Vansi falls, the Many-Arrow tribe suddenly finding itself without a leader.
column6: Defeat the leader of the Many-Arrow orc tribe, Vansi Bloodscar.

column4: You find Festersnout nose deep in his latest victim's carcass.
column5: You step over Festersnout's corpse and look around the room. Looks like he's collected many valuable trophies over the years.
column6: Ensure Festersnout his killed his last victim.

column4: One-Fang sits in the corner, sharpening his one good tooth.
column5: You snap the trademark tooth from One-Fang's mouth, proof of your victory.
column6: Don't let One-Fang sink his teeth into any more travelers.

column4: The massive and terrifying spider lowers herself from a massive web, fangs dripping with venom.
column5: Sinking your weapon deep into the spider's belly, you feel the full weight of the creature come crashing down, it's life force completely drained.
column6: Find and defeat the massive Valindra's Pet.

column4: Surrounded by a sea of spiderlings, the monster known as the Daughter of Lolth tends to some freshly-laid eggs.
column5: A million spiderlings cry out and then scatter as its mother falls lifeless to the ground.
column6: Defeat the monster known as the Daughter of Lolth.

column4: At the far end of the room you see the wererat that has been leading a string of recent attacks.
column5: With Varin dead, the constant wererat attacks should come to an end.
column6: Put a stop to the attacks led by Varin Chalgash.

column4: A nimble shadow darts across the room. You suspect you've found the elusive Southpaw.
column5: Standing over Southpaw's lifeless body, you make a threatening gesture at the other wererats, causing them to scatter into the shadows.
column6: Defeat Southpaw to collect the lucrative bounty.

column4: You're not sure if Deadeye is practicing for a battle, or if nocking an arrow is all he remembers how to do.
column5: His bow buried beneath his own pile of bones, you hope Deadeye can finally get some well-deserved rest.
column6: Send Deadeye back to his eternal rest.

column4: You assume the constant moans of torment are from leftover memories of Mount Hotenow.
column5: The room goes silent as Scorch falls into a pile of ash on the ground.
column6: Stop Scorch from forever reliving the pain of Mount Hotenow.
